channel.title: PI Muting
channel.description: What would you add to make it so when you mute someone it would come up with a box to ask you why you are muting this person, then the reason will be sent to the player, and the mute will only go through if the person has typed a reason, if they have not the mute will not go through. Can anyone help? I've tried for a hour to do this with different methods and i just can't get it. Any help will be appreciated. Thanks allot.

item.title: PI Muting
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

I suppose you could use the PM interface.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Muting
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

matzie:

There currently is no interface that supports this type of input. You would have to make a custom one. That or utilize a hinky chat system.

Closest to the interface OP wants is the report abuse interface.

Read full topic

item.title: PI Muting
item.dc:creator: @xKanex xKanex
item.description:
@xKanex wrote:

You could just add an additional argument to your mute command that asks for a quick explanation for using the command.

So the format would be like ::mute (name) (reason)

Or, you could have the ::mute command call for a follow up command that would require you to type a reason. For example:

  • ::mute (player)
  • “Please enter a reason for your mute by typing ::reason (reason)”
  • ::reason (reason)
  • Player is muted and reason is saved to a text file.

I feel that the second option would be easier since you don’t have to worry about weird substring cases.

Read full topic
